main event: Sighting of an unidentified flying object near Fort Worth, Texas on January 11, 1962.
interesting points: The object was round, 8-? ft. in diameter, and hovered at a low altitude (20 ft.) for 5-7 minutes before rising vertically into the overcast sky.
The object exhibited no apparent structure, was self-luminous, and apparently caused some ground illumination.

There were multiple sightings of unidentified objects in the vicinity of Sheppard Air Force Base on January 5, 1961. The objects were described as round, about 50 feet in diameter, and fluorescent in appearance.
One witness, Mrs. ____, had previously reported a 'cigar-shaped' object, but her judgment and reliability were considered questionable.
Another witness, Mr. _____, who was a programmer and weatherman, made an estimate of the object as it flew over his home in Iowa Park, Texas on January 5, 1961.
